comment: He wasn't very involved in the class (it was online) and so I'm can't necessarily evaluate him. However, the course has a lot of readings (a lot which are copied and pasted into the course and are all messed up, making reading them really annoying). It's an interesting course.

Good professor for my online class. He had extra credit, minimal tests, and would give you ample time to get quizzes and assignments done. He opened everything up for the weeks leading up to due dates so you could really plan your semester out. He also provided all readings in each unit, which I appreciate. This class was interesting!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: Class was easy, but pay attention to the readings. Actually read them and take notes. Quizzes had 4 questions, but weren't timed. Exams count fairly heavy but if you studied you'd do fine. I would take Williamson again. Interesting course!

Dr. Williamson was a good, nice prof. He posted lectures going through ppt slides, I didn't mind. Responded to emails somewhat quickly. The workload wasn't a lot, the class was extremely easy. You could use ppt's and articles (notes) he posted, on quizzes and tests (easy). Few discussions posts. 4 ex credit opportunities. Overall, would take again.

Really enjoyed this class, Prof Williamson gives great feedback and the course material in general is really interesting. The discussions were really nice & everything was graded reasonably & unbiased. The exams are pretty easy if you're socially aware & review the provided study guides. Great professor for an online class, interesting content.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Williamson has a very unique method of giving this class and it is not always the most efficient. Not very clear grading feedback and a whole lot of writing.
He's cool, just get involved in the discussion during classes

Although I liked him as a person, he was not the best when it came to teach, or communicating what it is we have to do. A LOT of information we only knew because of the class groupchats we made. He only graded a couple assignments that could make or break failing. He doesn't give clear instructions on how to do things unless its in the feedback.

I took it in the 4-wk summer session. One discussion, three short writing assignments, one quiz per module (only 5 questions) and three tests (not cumulative). Very quick with grading so you know where you stand. Interesting material - mix of videos and readings. You will learn a lot! Love that the whole class content opened on day one. Take him!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very straightforward class. 10 quizzes: use the answers to help on the 3 exams. Lockdown browser only for exams. One ethnographic assignment- basic, 2-4 pg paper, easy. Class is a pretty easy A: read the articles, take the quizzes and exams and write a paper. One E Credit opp. In terms of the professor, basically non-existent for such a course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Williamson is not a bad professor by all means. It is just hard for me to gauge a professor's teaching ability in an online class with the way he presents the class. ANTH 3307 was very straight forward and an easy good grade. I would recommend taking him for this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This professor didn't even act as if my class existed. I had to email the department head for them to grade any assignments, and even then the first grade was input on the final day of withdrawals, he still failed someone. He wouldn't respond to emails and I'm not sure he actually read my paper in the end, just graded it as an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Enjoyed this class. Class readings were very interesting and the work is not hard as long as you read the articles and watch the videos.
Wonderful materials to read that were actually very inspirational. Clear grading and only one paper!
Has lots of work for this class, weekly discussion posts, quizzes. He has 3 tests with multiple-choice and written responses. Does NOT answer emails when students have questions.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Took him for Cultural Anthropology. The readings were all online and pretty interesting. We had 3 tests and two short papers. His tests are insanely easy, even though I know I'm getting a B. He does not try to trip you up. The class is boring, but he is not difficult at all.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: If you aren't willing to participate in class discussions, this isn't the class for you. There were quizzes almost every week, but they are all online. However, you cannot use quizlet because they are based directly on the readings that he posts on D2L. Three exams. Group project for final which can be easy if you choose your partners wisely.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Definitely one of my favorite professors. Super knowledgeable and provided some really great readings for an intro class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: He is honestly  the best professor I've had. It was an extremely easy class. Just read, listen, and answer the questions. Dr. Williamson is really nice and really funny. And he makes the class discussions fun and interesting, and always has an adorable welcoming smile every class period. Would definitely take again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures

comment: Easy essay style tests, a couple of assignments, interesting topics and discussions in class. Love this professor!!

Wonderful Professor. Unpretentious, knowledgeable, caring and curious. Non-judgmental individual. Dr Williamson changed my life, literally! I am an adult, yet I grew in leaps and bounds in his class. Be prepared to have your preconceived ideas challenged, by your OWN self. The tests were challenging but not complicated. Do your reading. Loved him!

Dr. Williamson is a great professor. If you do not like to read, skip this class. If you don't mind participating and reading, sign up! Dr. Williamson is very approachable and although he is very educated in anthropology, he does not demean the student.

Dr. Williamson is a good, knowledgeable professor. Be warned that the class is discussion based around the readings you're supposed to do, so read and go to class. Very clear on what his expectations are, there are three tests and three (VERY SHORT) papers. Would love to have another class with him.

Great professor. Should note that CLASS IS DISCUSSION AND READING BASED!!!, much like a grad. course. Professor moderates discussion and lets students form their own opinions. Helpful and objective, he makes his class requirements clear. Would take again.

I always looked forward to coming to Dr. Williamsons' class because he always had the class so engaged. This class was very creative. His analysis are thought-provoking and engaging. His documentaries, videos and assigned books on Afro-Brazil captured the nature of Brazil. Dr. Williamson is very knowledgeable, extremely nice and easy-going.

This is one of the worst anthropology professors I have had. His lectures are unstructured and he is unclear when he is speaking and answering questions. He always beats around the bush and never makes a point. The texts are entirely descriptive and narrative based, detail oriented and draw no anthropologically relevant conclusions.

Great subject matter, lousy professor. He gives one pop quiz a week that is usually really easy if you do the readings. There is a semester long project that is pretty simple and kind of fun. My biggest complaint is when I went to his office for help he laughed at me. After you present your final project he criticizes you in front of all your peers

Very nice and approachable professor. He's very engaged in the subject matter and classroom discussions. Takes time to reinforce and expand on students' viewpoints during class discussions, which made it feel more complete.

I took Cultural Diversity in the United States with Mr. Williamson. His teaching style is a little awkward but he is very nice and is always willing to help. He told us exactly what was going to be on the exams. Two exams, easy weekly quizzes, and one major project. Very interesting and easy, I recommend!

Williamson did not teach anything. He assigned chapters to students to present and then had very detailed exams over the material without clarifying it for the class. The text was also terribly written for these purposes. I got an A for showing up and doing my presentation but I didn't take anything useful away from his class.

Class is interesting. Mandatory attendance for 2105 because each class there are presentations. Everyone does one presentation in the semester and there are 4 tests. The test were pretty tough because of the wording but he gave us extra credit to make up for it and made the last tests a bit easier. I liked professor Williamson.

Interesting class. The first test was confusing after that no problem if you read and attend the classes where he shows the films you will do well. His grading is not harsh. No extra credit chances in here but again if you read you will not need it. He is a very nice man. Really enjoyed the class in spite of the fact it was on Friday afternoons!

This class was very interesting and I'm not even a anthro.,is not my major. Most of the time we watched films, which will be on the test.You have to buy the books, because test will also be based off them. Cool professor, take him if you can. There is no reason anyone should fail this class. :)

If you study, you will pass! Attendance is not mandatory, but the videos and a few notes taken from the lectures will be on the test. You will need to buy the books for the class. Highly recommended to take!! Great professor!
